options.label: A
options.text: Electrons produced by thermionic emission in the cathode are accelerated towards the anode by the potential.

options.label: B
options.text: The anode is composed of a metal with a high melting temperature such as tungsten. . ,

options.label: C
options.text: X-rays are mostly produced by the sudden deceleration of electrons by the bremsstrahlung process.

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic x-rays are used in the production of medical radiation in diagnostic x-ray units, linear accelerators, and betatrons.

questions.correct_answer: D. Characteristic x-rays are used in the production of medical radiation in diagnostic x-ray units, linear accelerators, and betatrons.

options.label: A
options.text: Severity of effect varies with dose, and there is a threshold

options.label: B
options.text: Severity of the effect varies with dose, but there is no threshold

options.label: C
options.text: Probability of the effect varies with dose, and there is a threshold

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Severity of effect varies with dose, and there is a threshold
